Package dev.gruncan.spotify.objects.tracks.analysis

Class AudioSection

java.lang.Object
dev.gruncan.spotify.webapi.objects.tracks.analysis.AudioSection
All Implemented Interfaces:
SpotifyObject, Serializable
public class AudioSection extends Object implements SpotifyObject
Represents a spotify audio section

  • Constructor Details

    • AudioSection

      public AudioSection()

  • Method Details

    • getStart

      public double getStart()
      The starting point (in seconds) of the section.

    • getDuration

      public double getDuration()
      The duration (in seconds) of the section.

    • getConfidence

      public double getConfidence()
      The confidence, from 0.0 to 1.0, of the reliability of the section's "designation".

    • getLoudness

      public double getLoudness()
      The overall loudness of the section in decibels (dB). Loudness values are useful for comparing relative loudness of sections within tracks.

    • getTempo

      public double getTempo()
      The overall estimated tempo of the section in beats per minute (BPM). In musical terminology, tempo is the speed or pace of a given piece and derives directly from the average beat duration

    • getTempConfidence

      public double getTempConfidence()
      The confidence, from 0.0 to 1.0, of the reliability of the tempo. Some tracks contain tempo changes or sounds which don't contain tempo (like pure speech) which would correspond to a low value in this field.

    • getKey

      public int getKey()
      The estimated overall key of the section. The values in this field ranging from 0 to 11 mapping to pitches using standard Pitch Class notation (E.g. 0 = C, 1 = C♯/D♭, 2 = D, and so on). If no key was detected, the value is -1.

    • getKeyConfidence

      public double getKeyConfidence()
      The confidence, from 0.0 to 1.0, of the reliability of the key. Songs with many key changes may correspond to low values in this field.

    • getMode

      public double getMode()
      Indicates the modality (major or minor) of a section, the type of scale from which its melodic content is derived. This field will contain a 0 for "minor", a 1 for "major", or a -1 for no result. Note that the major key (e.g. C major) could more likely be confused with the minor key at 3 semitones lower (e.g. A minor) as both keys carry the same pitches.

    • getModeConfidence

      public double getModeConfidence()
      The confidence, from 0.0 to 1.0, of the reliability of the mode.

    • getTimeSignature

      public int getTimeSignature()
      An estimated time signature. The time signature (meter) is a notational convention to specify how many beats are in each bar (or measure). The time signature ranges from 3 to 7 indicating time signatures of "3/4", to "7/4".

    • getTimeSignatureConfidence

      public double getTimeSignatureConfidence()
      The confidence, from 0.0 to 1.0, of the reliability of the time_signature. Sections with time signature changes may correspond to low values in this field.

    • setStart

      public void setStart(double start)
      The starting point (in seconds) of the section.

    • setDuration

      public void setDuration(double duration)
      The duration (in seconds) of the section.

    • setConfidence

      public void setConfidence(double confidence)
      The confidence, from 0.0 to 1.0, of the reliability of the section's "designation".

    • setLoudness

      public void setLoudness(double loudness)
      The overall loudness of the section in decibels (dB). Loudness values are useful for comparing relative loudness of sections within tracks.

    • setTempo

      public void setTempo(double tempo)
      The overall estimated tempo of the section in beats per minute (BPM). In musical terminology, tempo is the speed or pace of a given piece and derives directly from the average beat duration

    • setTempConfidence

      public void setTempConfidence(double tempConfidence)
      The confidence, from 0.0 to 1.0, of the reliability of the tempo. Some tracks contain tempo changes or sounds which don't contain tempo (like pure speech) which would correspond to a low value in this field.

    • setKey

      public void setKey(int key)
      The estimated overall key of the section. The values in this field ranging from 0 to 11 mapping to pitches using standard Pitch Class notation (E.g. 0 = C, 1 = C♯/D♭, 2 = D, and so on). If no key was detected, the value is -1.

    • setKeyConfidence

      public void setKeyConfidence(double keyConfidence)
      The confidence, from 0.0 to 1.0, of the reliability of the key. Songs with many key changes may correspond to low values in this field.

    • setMode

      public void setMode(double mode)
      Indicates the modality (major or minor) of a section, the type of scale from which its melodic content is derived. This field will contain a 0 for "minor", a 1 for "major", or a -1 for no result. Note that the major key (e.g. C major) could more likely be confused with the minor key at 3 semitones lower (e.g. A minor) as both keys carry the same pitches.

    • setModeConfidence

      public void setModeConfidence(double modeConfidence)
      The confidence, from 0.0 to 1.0, of the reliability of the mode.

    • setTimeSignature

      public void setTimeSignature(int timeSignature)
      An estimated time signature. The time signature (meter) is a notational convention to specify how many beats are in each bar (or measure). The time signature ranges from 3 to 7 indicating time signatures of "3/4", to "7/4".

    • setTimeSignatureConfidence

      public void setTimeSignatureConfidence(double timeSignatureConfidence)
      The confidence, from 0.0 to 1.0, of the reliability of the time_signature. Sections with time signature changes may correspond to low values in this field.
